1.value: Welcome to Aldon's Crossing <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>!&&You have travelled many miles to arrive at the house of your late uncle.

10.value: Welcome to the Dragon's Scale, what do you need?

100.value: You have proven yourself and are an honor to your uncle's memory. Please become our Prefect and represent us in Aldon!

101.value: Thank you for your help Prefect.  Follow the road west to Aldon!

102.value: If a door or chest is locked, we are the key.  Some locks may require you to be a higher rank to open them, do not give up.

105.value: Thanks for helping us out, you should look us up in Aldon's Stand sometime. Oh yeah, here is something for ya.

106.value: Pssst...go talk to my brother Nade!  You can find him at the Inn!

11.value: I am having a serious rat problem in my cellar, huge dangerous rats are destroying my wares.

118.value: Welcome to Aldon's Arena, where adventurers come to prove themselves!

119.value: Welcome back brave adventurer! Are you ready to test your mettle?

12.value: Here is the key, you can find the cellar behind the store. Please end this rat problem.

120.value: Why, I am Doria, the Arena Priest.  I serve as Coordinator of bouts, and the Server of Last Rites.
120.choice_a: Can I die in the Arena?

121.value: Are you interested in a bout?

122.value: Die? Hmm... probably not, though it is possible, it rarely happens.

123.value: The Arena, is where brave adventurers come to prove themselves in deadly combat against evil monsters, based on their Arena Rank.

124.value: Excellent! Your current Arena rank is...

125.value: Arena Rank is earned by defeating monsters in the Arena.  No one as of yet has reached Champion.

126.value: With 5 or more victories, you are a Beginner.

127.value: With 10 or more victories, you are a Novice.

128.value: With 15 or more victories, you are Seasoned.

129.value: With less than 5 victories, you are Unranked.

13.value: Thank you for helping me, please take this as a reward.

130.value: With 20 or more victories, you are an Expert.

131.value: With 30 or more victories, you are a Veteran.

132.value: With 50 or more victories, you are a Master.

133.value: With 80 or more victories, you are the Champion!

136.value: You were defeated!&You have lost an Arena Rank point.

137.value: Be careful travelling adventurer, many dangerous creatures await the unwary.

138.value: I only deals wif da Unseen Hand...

139.value: Since youse is one of us, I cans deal wif you. Youse wanna sees my wares?

14.value: Thank you for your help, I am very grateful.

140.value: Here lies Bill...&or is he alive still?

141.value: Here lies Pat&Buried so long&His cat would not follow&and now he is gone.

142.value: Here lies ole Charlie:&King of Thieves&Now lies with Angels.

143.value: Poor aulde Mike&Thought he was a vampire&That's why the spike.

144.value: Here lies Richard&And his trusty cat&Fought like heroes&til an ogre squashed'em flat.

145.value: Here is a grave&It contains Dave&but don't cry and say oh no&It's only Dave Lupo

146.value: Her hviler Kjetil&et offer i jakten p�&onde bugs i koden

147.value: To our fallen hero&His name was ASher&He was mighty and tall&Til he met the Master&He was quite a wonder&But now&he is six feet under

148.value: Moebius Benoit&Lies Here&He was&Master of Magic&in this world&Now he IS&Magic&in the Next

149.value: Brooks&Born: 1980&Died: 1976&No, we don't know&how he did it either

15.value: This door is locked and requires a key.

150.value: Hello, I am Noria, the Arena Scorekeeper, would you like to know your rank?

151.value: I am Gustav, I am the caretaker for the monsters used in the Arena.

152.value: Welcome to Arena Armor, what can I do for you?

153.value: Welcome to Arena Weapons, what can I do for you?

154.value: Welcome to the Arena Store, what can I do for you?

155.value: Arena fights get harder as your rank increases.

156.value: I find this Arena combat barbaric and dishonorable to the memory of Aldon.

157.value: My husband died in the Arena, so I know its possible to die in there.

158.value: Be careful in the Arena, if you are defeated, you lose a rank point.

159.value: Aldon's Stand isn't ready for visitors, but the Arena to the North is!

16.value: You search the crates and find something!

160.value: This sign is faded and worn but you can just make out:&SOUTH: Fort Darkmoor&written underneath the crude scrawl that now says:& Fort Thok!&Orks ONLEE!

161.value: Kostya lies here&He died in combat&While of drinking beer&He hasn't noticed rat&One bite, so game's over&Be careful, follower!

162.value: Here lies David&His pets were in the way&he could not run&and lost that day.

163.value: Though was indeed&quite a scandal,&He fought a giant&he couldn't handle.&And now we mourn.&Here lies Randall.

164.value: I fought and traveled&and mysteries unravelled&till a zombie waited for me.&So here lies thief Nick&dead at the door&he last picked.

165.value: Here lies Loeke&twas in a fight&and tried to flee.&Tried to run and hide&but his shoe was untied.&He fell on his face&bumped his head and died.

166.value: Protector of all&He always stood tall&Defending our town&Fighting dragons down&After he was hit&He still would not quit&Killed by a ghost&Here now lies Azmeos.

167.value: Good 'ole Munkie,&Strong and Agile,&Landed on her staff,&So she will nap for a while.

168.value: Here lies Michael L.&All was going well&That is at least until&He was fighting away&And a brute named Gunch&Rang his bell.

170.value: The sign reads:&NORTH: Lupan Farms&EAST: Black Springs&WEST: Five Dials

171.value: The sign reads:& NORTH: Aldon's Stand

173.value: These gates are closed for security reasons.

174.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to Aldon's Stand!

175.value: Here lies Kara,&Laid out flat,&Gnawed to death&By a Momma Rat.

176.value: Here lies Josh Carlson&he wasn't to bright,he was very dim&he attacked his pet dog&which caused it to maul him.

177.value: Rob Rendell was walking&alone one day.&Dave Lupo was coming&the other way.&Mage Lupo had written&a brand new spell.&he tested it out&on Rob Rendell.

178.value: Please take me back to my Mom!

179.value: Loranna seems almost ready to faint when you give her the bad news about Timmy.

180.value: Thank you for trying to rescue him, please accept this.

181.value: Thank you for rescuing my beloved son!

182.value: Thank you for trying to help me, I am grateful.

183.value: The sign reads:&The Last Stand Inn.&All are welcome!

184.value: Welcome to the Last Stand Inn, Adventurer.  What can I do for you today?

185.value: The sign reads:&Jenny's General Store:&Various and Sundry Items.

186.value: The sign reads:&Grundahar's Smithy.&Private Smithing Contracts Only.&Inquire within.&

187.value: Welcome to my General Store, what can I do for you today?

188.value: You came from Black Spring?  You probably met my brother, his name is Renny.

189.value: The sign reads:&The Swift Blade& Finest Weapons available.

19.value: As you step into the room, the mother of the rats snarls at you and leaps for your throat!

190.value: The sign reads:&Tarn's Tackle& Fine armors and shields.

191.value: Welcome to my shop, what do you need?

192.value: The right weapon is important for the job. Some creatures are resistant or even immune to certain types of weapons and magic.

193.value: Welcome to Tarn's Tackle, what can I do for you today?

194.value: This store belongs to my husband, Tarn. He has been missing for quite some time, and I am worried.

195.value: I sense you will do a great deal of travelling, if you find him, or find out what happened to him, please tell me!

197.value: I hope you find my husband soon!

199.value: Thank you for bringing my beloved husband back home to me.

2.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the town of Black Spring.

20.value: You search the refuse and find something!

200.value: Might I impose upon you to help me?

201.value: My husband Cranos, who runs this lighthouse, is missing. He went to the woods west of here to find herbs for my medicine.

202.value: He hasn't returned yet and I am worried about him.  If he went too far to the west he might be lost in the Spider Forest.
202.choice_b: I hope he makes it back.

204.value: Find Cranos in the Spider Forest.

205.value: Thank you for rescuing my husband!

206.value: You give Joanna the news about Cranos, and she begins to sob uncontrollably:&Oh Cranos, my beloved Cranos I am so sorry!

207.value: Cranos seems groggy from a spider bite: Thank you brave one, please help me return to my Joanna so I can give her this medicine.

208.value: As you step into the clearing, you see a huge bloated spider hunched over a comatose dwarf, the spider turns to face you...

209.value: You search the corpse and find something...

21.value: Welcome to my store, what do you need?

210.value: As you enter the alcove, you see a goblin shaman engaged in some dark ritual sacrifice...

211.value: The sign reads:& The City Council of Everon.&   Duty,&   Honor,&   and Service.

212.value: On the rack you find a weapon!

213.value: On the rack you find a piece of armor!

214.value: Conquer the Three and you're set free, two by blade and then by running, then go down and keep on hunting!

215.value: Welcome child!&I am Sir Kenison, the last of the Order of Ateb Retset.

216.value: I have not had any guests for a long, long time...

217.value: I am the guardian of the Ateb Retset dungeon.  It holds many trolls and tribulations, heh heh.&Get it?

218.value: If you wished, I could teleport you to the entrance of the dungeon, but be warned, it is very very dangerous!

219.value: Here is the key to the dungeon exit, you can use it to leave once you pass the first test, though few do! Good luck!

22.value: Welcome to the Green Monkey Inn, what can I do for you?

221.value: This gate is locked and requires a key.

222.value: Oh! Please keep any eye out for my storage key down there, will ya?  I lost it last time when I was..uh cleaning..up.

223.value: Ah! I see you have found my key, excellent! Please accept this reward!

224.value: You search the barrel and find something!

227.value: You hear a rumbling sound vibrating through the dungeon walls!

229.value: Congratulations! You have passed to first test of the Ateb Retset dungeon!  You may continue as you please now.

23.value: The sign reads:&Black Spring Sheriff.  Law Enforcement and Peacekeeping.

230.value: What tha, how did you get in here?!&FREDO!, worthless no good assistant. Oh, I'll just kill you now.

231.value: Master..he is expecting you..go on! Go on to house, use magic spots. He He He.

233.value: Please brave adventurer, you must help me!

234.value: In the slums in the west of the city there lives an evil witch named Valeesh.

235.value: She cast an evil spell on my beloved child Ricky, now he is in great pain and dying!

236.value: If you were to bring me the Fretreline Root she has, I could break the spell!

237.value: Find Valeesh, get her Fretreline Root.

238.value: So...you've come from Helene eh? I suppose she told you I'm a witch?

239.value: Well she has lied to you child.  She has been trying to complete a dangerous spell on that child for some time now.

24.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the Holy Redeemer Church, come in and be well.

240.value: But I alone possess the Fretreline Root she needs to complete the spell.
240.choice_b: Give it to me or die!

241.value: She screams at you and leaps to attacks!

242.value: I will give you a Flansand Root instead, it will cure the child and free him from the spell.

243.choice_b: Give me the root or die!

245.value: Take this Flansand Root, tell her it is the Fretreline Root, she wont know the difference!

246.value: Have you brought me the root?

247.value: HA HA HA!& You fell for my evil trick! Now witness my true power!

248.value: There is a gentle glow surrounding the child, and then the child is gone!

249.value: Its not possible!&IT'S NOT POSSIBLE!&You betrayed me!

25.value: The sign reads:&Academy of Magical and Mystical Arts.

250.value: The child seems to be deluded:&Please..the pain, please kill me...

251.value: Are you sure you won't kill me? The pain is very bad...

253.value: Look, if your not going to kill me, can you at least go make me some food or something?

254.value: A bright glow surrounds Ricky, he begins to burn and change!

255.value: Thank you for saving me! Valeesh is going to take care of me and teach me to be a wizard!

256.value: Do you wish to enter this door?

257.value: You search the coffin and find something!

258.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the Institute and Museum of Arcane Studies.

259.value: Welcome to the Sea Sells Seashells Inn, what do you need?

26.value: This is Unseen Hand territory, thieves only.

260.value: Business is slow right now, but will pick up again once storm season dies down.

261.value: My feet sure are sore, but my work day never seems to end

262.value: My late husband was an adventurer. He should have carried more potions with him.

263.value: I'm the Sheriff of this village. What can I do for you?

264.value: You search the bookshelf and find various books, notes, and scrolls...

265.value: You also find a personal note, it reads:&Pre taken care of, continue with plan. Kill any who find out.&It is signed only with the letter 'R'.

266.value: The sign reads:&Kindly Paw Pet Store

267.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Water Works.

268.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand&Hall of Records and Artifacts

269.value: The sign reads:&Lesser Fire Elemental&Plane of Fire&  Immune:Fire&  Weak:Ice

27.value: The thief draws his weapon, "That was a mistake." he says with a hiss.

270.value: The sign reads:&Lesser Air Elemental&Plane of Air&  Resists:Physical&  Weak:Magic

271.value: The sign reads:&Lesser Earth Elemental&Plane of Earth&  Resists:Physical&  Weak:None

272.value: The sign reads:&Lesser Ice Elemental&Plane of Water&  Immune:Ice&  Weak:Fire

273.value: The sign reads:&Fire Elemental&Plane of Fire&  Immune:Fire&  Weak:Ice

274.value: The sign reads:&Air Elemental&Plane of Air&  Resists:Physical&  Weak:Magic

275.value: The sign reads:&Earth Elemental&Plane of Earth&  Resists:Physical&  Weak:None

276.value: The sign reads:&Ice Elemental&Plane of Water&  Immune:Ice&  Weak:Fire

277.value: There is a strange machine here with with a large red button.  The machine is currently *OFF*.

28.value: The only way to join the Unseen Hand, is to steal something of value, interested?

280.value: There is a strange machine here with with a large red button.  The machine is currently *ON*.

281.value: The sign reads:&This is the second prototype sewer cleaning machine built by Grundahar and Morx.

282.value: The sign reads:&This is the first prototype sewer cleaning machine built by Grundahar and the Late Tigron.

283.value: The water being processed by the magical machine is the cleanest you have ever seen!

284.value: Here is your badge of office, you will need this badge to gain audience with the Council at Aldon's Stand. Don't lose it!

285.value: I am Morx the Magical! I helped Grundahar design and build the famous Sewer Cleaning Machine!  Surely you have heard of me?

286.value: Ah yes, you are obviously a person of great intellect and studying.

287.value: Well, Grundahar and I worked quite closely on it and without my magical expertise, it would have failed.

288.value: Well...Tigron worked on it at first, but was accidentally killed when it exploded.  I took his place.

289.value: Only Prefects, or those with appointments are allowed to enter the Council Chambers.

29.value: Hmmm, Father Keegan has a nice gold statue, go get it for me and then you can pass.

290.value: Where is your badge of office 'Prefect'? Get out of here before I have you arrested.

291.value: You show the guard your badge of office:&Welcome Prefect, you may pass.

292.value: I don't see your name in the appointment roster, please leave now.

293.value: Welcome to Aldon's Stand, I am Hansen, the Council Clerk, how can I help you today?

294.value: If you are looking for the Council Chamber, Go through the doors to the west, then up the stairs either to the north or south.

295.value: You are not a Prefect, and you don't have an appointment. You should not be here, leave now.

296.value: This blood crusted altar appears to be dedicated to some dark necromantic cult. Some of the blood is still fresh...

297.value: Ah you are the new Prefect from Black Springs. Let us hope you are not as stubborn as your uncle was.

298.value: I didn't mean to offend!  He was a good man, if a tad bit stubborn.  He had trouble seeing the big picture sometimes.  A shame about his death though.

299.value: Well, he was attacked and killed by bandits on the way back to Black Springs. The bandits were never caught.

3.value: Welcome to the Dragon's Tooth, what do you need?

300.value: Well, we weren't able to determine that exactly. His body was found on the road, but it could have been moved. I'm sure the bandits are gone by now.

301.value: If you wish to continue the investigation, feel free to.  Maybe the village to the south knows something. Now what about this undead problem?

302.value: Well, this is interesting. Will you help us investigate this further?

303.value: Ah the Prefect from Black Springs, what can we do for you today?

305.value: There is a legendary book of knowledge, called the Decessus Tome. It holds knowledge we might find useful in this undead business.

306.value: Hmm, a shame. Oh well, return and talk to me if you change your mind.

307.value: Excellent! Talk to Father Horrace over at the Church of the Redeemer, he has much knowledge of such things.

308.value: Welcome to the Hall of Records and Artifacts, I am Clerk Antaeus.  How can I help you?

309.value: The Decessus Tome? Yes I have heard of it. It is an evil book full of dark necromantic spells. Why do you wish to know where it is?

31.value: Crispin glares at you: "Do you have my statue?"

311.value: I too have heard these rumors of the dead stirring. I do not believe you can fight this evil with another evil. Still...

313.value: Will you help us find the Decessus Tome?

314.value: The Decessus Tome? Hmmm, let me check my records...

315.value: Yes, the Decessus Tome, recovered 117 years ago by Dartan the Warrior after defeating the Dark Death Cult.

316.value: Oh, it is here, in our underground vault.

317.value: Oh, of course Prefect.  Here is the key to the vault.

319.value: The dusty sign on the sealed chest reads 'Decessus Tome', do you open the chest?

32.value: Ah, great job! Here is something for your trouble. Go on in.

320.value: You carefully open the chest, and...its empty.  The Tome is not here.

322.value: The Decessus Tome is not here.

323.value: You may enter or leave the city.

324.value: The Tome is gone?  How is this possible? Oh my goodness, this is horrible! You must go tell the Council!

325.value: The Tome has been stolen? This is concerning, we really need that book. You must find it, I would suggest starting with the Thieves' Guild.

326.value: The Thieves' Guild?  I don't know, do I look like a thief? Try the Inn, or maybe the slums. There often unsavory types there.

328.value: Greeting Prefect, how may I be of service?

329.value: Be careful in the lands to the west, they are wild and un-tamed.

33.value: You search the priest's bookshelf and find the statue Crispin is looking for.

330.value: A Thief's Guild? Well..I don't know exactly where it is, but there is some funny business going on at the warehouse.

331.value: The thief stares at you coldly and says;&'Start talking...'

332.value: The sign reads:&Order of Ateb Retset.

333.value: Find them and kill them, then you will have the book.

334.value: The gruff blacksmith looks up at you.

335.value: After the tragedy in the mine, there is nothing left to work with.

336.value: The mine is closed and there is nothing anyone can do. Our people, if any left alive, are trapped.

337.value: While opening a new level, we broke through a wall...they were waiting for us, they knew.

338.value: Orcs, Goblins, and something far more dangerous.  Summoned by their foul magics. So much death...

34.value: Lord Yorrick is wise, and there might be knowledge to be had within the Tome that could shed light on this undead business.

340.value: Please! Without your help, we will never get the mines open.

341.value: Thank you for your help, I am very grateful.

342.value: The sign reads:&Rolynd's Dwarven Smithy&Weapons and Armors.

343.value: You have come to us in dire times adventurer. If something isn't done soon, we will all be done for.

345.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Mausoleum&Within here are the unknown fallen dead from the Great War.  May they rest in peace.

346.value: You notice in the distance a shrouded individual fidgeting with the wall...

347.value: The shrouded individual opens a secret door and slips inside. This must be the rogue thieves' guild!

349.value: Welcome fellow privateer. May your mind stay sharp, and your step remain soft.

35.value: You should speak with Clerk Antaeus over at the Hall of Records and Artifacts. He might have knowledge of the Tome.

350.value: We have been expecting you, go on down and speak with our Guild Mistress.

352.value: Since you are of the Order of the Unseen Hand, would you like to see my wares?

353.value: We do not consider ourselves thieves, but more like freedom loving minstrels...or something.

354.value: I have many ears and eyes and I knew you would be looking for me, maybe we can help each other...

355.value: I did not take the Decessus Tome, but I know who did.  There is a rogue thieves guild operating here in the city...

357.value: Return when you have defeated the rogue guild and I will reward you.

358.value: The thief seems genuinely surprised to see you.& 'What are you doing here?!'

359.value: Well, it appears we have an unwelcome guest! Kill him!

36.value: Welcome to the Church of the Redeemer, how may I be of service to you?

360.value: The Decessus Tome is not here.  You were either lied to or someone else has it.

361.value: My spies tell me you have succeeded in destroying the rogue guild! You have my thanks!

362.value: Ah yes the Tome.  I have a small confession to make, I had it all along. My guild was the one who stole it.

363.value: My spies told me the Tome had all of a sudden become a very desired item and I thought to make some gold offering it to the highest bidder.

364.value: Then I found out just how much trouble this Tome is causing, and then you came along. Right then I decided to get what use I could out of it, sorry.

365.value: Absolutely, you have earned it, and a little extra!

366.value: Talk to the clerk downstairs if you need work.

367.value: Congratulations Prefect!  You have done well.  We will begin studying the Tome so that we may better understand what or who our enemy is.

369.value: The sign reads:&Smelting Furnace and Ore Refinement- Watch your hands, work safe.

37.value: I have heard from the Sheriff and Henry reports of the dead rising from the grave. I fear someone is working a great evil there. Maybe even... hmmm.

370.value: The sign reads:&Foreman's Office&and&Iron Ore Warehouse

371.value: In the bed looking almost peaceful, is Dorgan's wife. She passed away from her wounds received in battle.

372.value: The sign reads:&Down to the Mines, level 1.

373.value: The sign reads:&Smelting Furnace and Refinery. Watch your hands, work safely.

374.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the Village of Storm Rock.

375.value: I will not refuse your aid, so desperate are we. I will inform the guard to allow you in. Please save anyone you can

376.value: The guard looks at you:&'Talk to the foreman.'

377.value: The sign reads:&Quarters of Clan Chief Dorgan.

378.value: The sign reads:&Fordanig's Apothecary.&Potions and Powders.

379.value: You see a dwarven fighter who has been wounded many times, and seems on the verge of collapse.

38.value: Go there and strike down the evil person doing this, whomever it is, they have gone too far.

380.value: Aye...physically I am well, though my spirit I fear will never recover from this horror.

381.value: Once the invasion...the slaughter began, me, mine wife, and a few others tried to fight to the surface. We were forced to retreat here.

382.value: He seems about to break down:&'My wife, Gregos take her, died from her wounds.'

383.value: She was a bonnie lass. The others died as we fought to keep them out. Then I guess they got smart and just sealed us in to starve to death.

384.value: I've been waiting for an opportunity to try my escape so I might search for survivors and regroup my people.

385.value: Thank you brave one, if you can help me to the mine entrance, I can take it from there and begin the regrouping and rebuilding.

387.value: Thank you friend. You have saved our village. I will begin the rebuilding process.

388.value: Thank you for rescuing our Clan Chief! Please accept this reward!

389.value: The evil still remains within our mines, please help us!

39.value: I feared it was Horrigan, returned to seek vengeance. His thirst for power carried him too far. Please accept this reward.

390.value: Welcome to our temple, how may I be of service to you?

391.value: The sign reads:&In memory of those lost during the Invasion, and <INSERT_THE_PLAYER> who saved us.

392.value: Welcome to the Gold Vein Inn, what can I do for you?

393.value: I sure hope our Clan Chief is alive...

394.value: You search and find a secret recess with something inside!

395.value: The sign lists the names of all of the Dwarves killed by the invading evil.

396.value: Our Clan Chief must be dead...oh surely we are a doomed people..

397.value: Thank you adventurer for helping my people.

398.value: These dwarves obviously gave their lives to seal the tunnel...

399.value: Argh! You have gotten past my minions! I will not disappoint the Mistress!

4.value: Do you wish to buy or sell?

40.value: HA HA! My weakling brother has sent YOU to defeat me?

400.value: The crazed mage screams at his minions:&'Kill the interloper, kill for the Mistress!'

401.value: HA! You think I would tell you of her plans?! You will never defeat her because you will die HERE!

402.value: You search the sacks of grain and find something!

404.value: I am Kohan, the Elder of this village. How can I help you?

405.value: The old man looks at you:&' You lookin to buy something?'

406.value: I used to roam the sewers collectin this stuff but now I'm gettin old, so I try to sell some to make a livin.

407.value: This is Lupan Farms adventurer, what can I do for you?

408.value: The Elder seems to study you:& We have a problem with a dangerous Ogre, can you aid us?

409.value: One of the village children, Maggie, was playing in the fields south of where we are now when she disappeared.

41.value: He didn't tell you? Keegan, my brother, was afraid to face me! HA HA! I will raise your body to serve me!

410.value: While we were searching for Maggie, a huge ogre ran at us yelling. We managed to hold it off with torches and pitchforks.

411.value: We backed the ogre into the cellar and locked the door. We can only assume that this ogre got poor Maggie.

412.value: Will you get rid of this ogre for us? Understand if you fail, we will suffer the beast's wrath.

413.value: The other villagers might have something to say now that you are helping us.

414.value: Praise the Redeemer Maggie is alive! She came to us and told us about the ogre.

415.value: It appears we were all terribly mistaken about the ogre, he wasn't evil at all, he just wanted to tell us about Maggie.

416.value: Please accept our apologies, and this reward.

417.value: Thank you again adventurer. I still carry the shame over that poor ogre. May the Redeemer forgive me.

418.value: Thank you adventurer, Doohan the ogre is a great blessing to us all!

419.value: Maybe you can help us. First you must speak with Kohan, our village elder.

42.value: Bah! So you have come for the boy! Come! Take key from my hand if you can!

420.value: Maggie was last seen playing in the east fields.

421.value: Maggie told us that the ogre was a gentle and kind beast. I feel shame at judging it to swiftly.

422.value: There is a small hole here where the ground has given way.  It is just big enough for a child.

423.value: We are very thankful for you saving Maggie. A shame that we misjudged the ogre, but who could have known?

424.value: Others didn't see where the ogre came from, but I swear it came FROM the cellar.

425.value: At least the ogre is trapped in the cellar. It will starve there because everyone knows ogres only eat meat.

426.value: The woman has obviously been crying a great deal and is very upset.

427.value: Renee seems much better now, she turns to you smiling:&'Hello!'

428.value: Please! Go talk to Elder Kohan, I hope you can help us!

429.value: I don't care what it takes, just please kill that horrible beast the took my Maggie from me!

43.value: You must get the key from the big ugly.  Please hurry!

430.value: Praise the Redeemer Maggie is alive! I feel so terrible about that poor ogre, he was only trying to help.

431.value: Thank you for saving Maggie, and for being more kind and understanding than I was.

432.value: My late husband was an adventurer too, and he no longer has a need for this, please take it.

433.value: Maggie seems recovered from her ordeal.

434.value: You killed Doohan! He was my friend! Go away meanie! I don't like you!

435.value: Thank you for not killing Doohan!  He is my friend, and he is very nice.  You are nice too!

436.value: Maggie says you are a meanie for killing the ogre, but I'm just glad Maggie is back! Thank you!

437.value: The child looks up at you with large innocent eyes:&'Hello.'

438.value: We aren't allowed to play in the east fields no more cause of the monster that got Maggie.  I miss her.

439.value: Me tank you fer hepping Doohan. Dese hummies nice to mes now, dey gimme veggeetables and stuffs. Me give you dis fer hepping me!

44.value: Welcome what can I do for you?

441.value: on the crude wooden sign is scrawled:&'If yoo reed yoo no come here, go!'

442.value: This wall is crumbling, perhaps you could push it down.

443.value: The wall falls away as you push on it.

444.value: You cannot move, perhaps from the other side...

445.value: You are too late to save his victims, but you can stop him from doing it again!

446.value: After the death of the little evil shaman, the altar stops glowing.

447.value: You have entered the 'throne room' of Thok the Brutal; he turns to address you...

448.value: So puny humie, you have invaded my fortress, for this you shall die!

449.value: So, you were the one who killed my cousin Gunch, now you shall die too!

45.value: My son has been taken by Gunch a vile orc who leads the goblins that live south of town in the old mine.

451.value: As you begin to enter the room, a large ogre runs at you yelling!

452.value: At the last second the ogre stops and stares at you.&'You not hurt Doohan?'

453.value: You means Mag-geee da small hummie? Me not hurt her, she over der (points to the corner).

454.value: Me not like oder ogres no more, me no eats meat, just veggeeetables. Tribe make me leave, no welcome no more.

455.value: Me snuck in here at dark, lookin fer foods. Me sleep. Mag-gee fall tru tha roof. Me try to tell bigger hummies.

456.value: Tha big hummies poke and burn poor Doohan. Me run back down and dey locks me in. What me do now?

457.value: Oh tank you nice hummie! Me wait heres till you goes tell dem!

46.value: I cannot pay his ransom and his spies will alert him if I try to leave the city.

460.value: This must be Maggie, Renee's missing daughter.

461.value: Thank you for not killing Doohan! He is very nice, and kept the rats away! I'll go tell everyone how nice he is!

462.value: You killed him! You killed him! He was nice to me, he didn't hurt anyone! You are so mean! (the child runs off).

463.value: Someone, or something has carefully opened these bags and consumed a large quantity of grain.

464.value: I don't have any jobs for you right now.

465.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Barracks and Militia.

466.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Sheriff's Office and Jail.

467.value: The sign reads:&If you are here to aid in my tests, please step on the portal, otherwise please leave. Experienced beings only.

468.value: I think there is a Momma Rat, kill her and the rest will hopefully scatter.

469.value: Welcome to the Kindly Paw Pet Store, how may I help you?

47.value: I have heard rumors of a secret door west of the entrance to the main hall in the old mine.

470.value: Ha ha! Zipfritzle sees that another has come to be my test subject! Oh goody goody!

471.value: Oh yes, yes! You will join the others already here! None of them wanted to be my test subjects either, he he he! But you can't get out now!

472.value: Oh I was mad! I got so angry at them for trying to spoil my tests! Now you will take the tests if you want to live!

473.value: You will face the Three Challenges right now, of course!

474.value: The sign reads:&If you are reading this, then you have passed the Strength Challenge! Now I need a new zombie.

475.value: The sign reads:&This corpse had his head crushed.

476.value: The sign reads:&This elvish warrior has only a quiver of arrows for company.

477.value: You hear a rumbling, grinding noise in the distance.

478.value: The sign reads:&If you are reading this, then you have passed the Wisdom Challenge! You are really starting to upset me.

479.value: The sign reads:&If you are reading this, then you must be Zipfritzle! Because anyone else would be dead by now.

48.value: Come back later, I might have something to tell you.

480.value: The crazy mage hasn't even seen you yet.

481.value: Hmmm? Yes? Who is...huh? Who are you, how did you...you..hmm. Mental note, increase test difficulty.

482.value: Zipfritzle! My name is ZIPFRITZLE! Just stand there and let me kill you already.

483.value: Ack!...gurgle...argh. Uhhh, mental note, uhm..turn off escape teleporterrrrr.....&The mage is dead.

484.value: The sign reads:&Domicile of Zipfritzle, Wizard!

485.value: Hello, I am Krundahan the City Engineer, what can I do for you?

486.value: My main job here is the operation of the City Water Works, insuring the sewage system is functioning properly. But lately there have been problems...

487.value: Someone or something has been turning off the sewer machines. Without the machines keeping the sewer clean, we are starting to get a serious rat problem.

488.value: Rats spread disease, disease in a city can spread quickly and kill a lot of people.
488.choice_a: So turn the machines back on.

489.value: Some of these rats are really big. I got attacked by one and now I can barely walk. I need you to turn them on for me. I will reward you.

49.value: The Gravedigger stares at you with pleading eyes: "Please, listen to my story!"

490.value: There are 10 machines that are off right now, just find them and press the large red button to turn them on.

492.value: There are still some machines that are off.

494.value: There is a strange machine here with with a large red button.  The machine is currently *ON*.

495.value: The door is sealed, and won't open...yet.

496.value: There is no visible lock or keyhole, you try to open the door...

498.value: I opened the sealed door so that I might see who is working so hard to disrupt my hard work.

499.value: Do you have any idea how far you have set me back? The mistress will be most displeased.

5.value: There is a chest here, do you wish to open it?

50.value: The dead are rising from their graves! I buried Old Ms.Burgress last week, and yesterday she was stumbling around the graves! I hit her with my shovel to get away!

500.value: Don't think for a moment you will get any information from me, I will just have to kill you now.

501.value: You also find a personal note, it reads:&'D' plan imperative, city must be in chaos. Kill any who interfere.&It is signed only with the letter 'R'.

502.value: You did it! The machines are all running! This strange person must have been siphoning the magic in the machines for her vile purposes.

504.value: The sign reads:&Sewer Aux. Machines #8, #9, and #10.

51.value: Please, talk to the Sheriff!  He doesn't believe me on account of my drinkin problem, but maybe he will believe you!
51.choice_a: I'll see what I can do.

512.value: I want no trouble out of you, move along.

513.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Market Square.

514.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Aldon and Loriana.

515.value: Ohhhh, many visitors I don't get. Been here a loooong time, have many items for sale!

516.value: You are almost done! But beware, the next level is moooooost challenging!

517.value: Congratulations! You have completed the Ateb Retset dungeon! Here is your long awaited reward!

518.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Father Michael the Pious.

519.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Magus Anthony the Seer.

52.value: The old gravedigger sits here nursing a bottle of beer, and sobbing softly.

520.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Peter the Blessed Wolf.

521.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Sir David the Brute.

522.value: Here lies Holy Brother Michael de Judge.&Brother Judge lost his life defending Aldon's Stand. There is a strange slot on the front of the tombstone.

523.value: Your golden token begins to glow, do you wish to insert it into the strange slot?

524.value: A strange glowing spirit appears to you:&'Use this to defend my city brave one.'

525.value: Here lies Anthony the Seer.&Anthony lost his life defending Aldon's Stand. There is a strange slot on the front of the tombstone.

526.value: Here lies Peter the Rogue.&Peter, also know as the Blessed Wolf, lost his life defending Aldon's Stand. There is a strange slot on the front of the tombstone.

527.value: Here lies David the Brute.&David lost his life defending Aldon's Stand. There is a strange slot on the front of the tombstone.

528.value: The sign reads:&Here rest the four valiant adventurers who gave their all, so that we may have Aldon's Stand today.

529.value: Hey, my condolences about your uncle, a real shame what the town did to him.

53.value: Sheriff Calden at your service, let me know if you have any questions.

530.value: Well, I meant no offense, just seems weird to bury him in his backyard like he was a dead family hamster or something.

531.value: Old Hansen shuffles through some papers:&'Jobs? Hmmm, ok...hmmm let me see here.'

532.value: A runner arrived from Lupan Farms, which is west of Black Springs. He is requesting aid for some sort of ogre problem.

533.value: Cranos, who operates the lighthouse south of Black Springs has gone missing. His wife is requesting aid.

534.value: Helene the mage, who lives here in Aldon's Stand in the warehouse district, is requesting aid for her sick son.

535.value: Krundahan, who runs the Aldon's Stand Water Works south of here, is requesting aid.

536.value: Far to the south lies Ft. Darkmoor. It was abandoned many years ago, and has since been occupied by orcs and such.

537.value: They are ruled by a particularly ruthless orc by the name of Thok. He is starting to become a real threat and danger, eliminate him.

538.value: I see you have eliminated that brute Thok, excellent! here is your reward!

539.value: This should be easy, Zip..fizz, Zipfriz, er Zip-something is a mage, and he needs help with his tests. He can be found in the northern part of the city.

54.value: Been talking to Henry, heh? Well, your Uncle was a good and honest man, so I will believe you. Investigate the cemetery and report.

540.value: Hmm, this isn't really a mission, but Sir Kenison is looking for someone to brave the Dungeon of Ateb Retset, interested?

541.value: The Order of Ateb Retset can be found in the mountains south of Aldon's Stand.

542.value: The sign reads:&WEST:Village of Storm Rock&Beware of Ogres!

543.value: The sign reads:&SOUTH:Village of Storm Rock&Dangerous journey, use caution.

544.value: Dire news! The village of Storm Rock has been invaded! Please go and investigate it immediately!

545.value: Exit Aldon's Stand, take the road east, then take the road south. At the next fork, take the road west. At the next fork, go south. From there, follow the signs. Be careful!

546.value: Please leave my house before I call the guards.

547.value: I have never been beyond Aldon's Stand's West Gates, too many dangerous creatures roam there!

548.value: A brave adventurer should always have a faithful companion. If you need one, goto the Kindly Paw Pet Store or visit the Last Stand Inn.

549.value: The sign reads:&For sale! Roomy one room house, thick walls! Interested parties inquire wit...(The rest cannot be made out).

55.value: The cemetery is east of town. Leave town and follow the road to the east, can't miss it.

550.value: The cook stares at you with a crazed look:&'eh? uh 45, no wait 32, 12...61...' (mumble, mumble).

551.value: The busy waitress stops to talk to you for a minute...

552.value: Madancia is still extremely dangerous, many who travel there, never return!

553.value: Aldon was a brave and noble warrior, when he died it broke Princess Loriana's heart, and she never married!

554.value: Rumor:&They say that Aldon was actually from Madancia! Can you imagine? How ridiculous!

555.value: The mercenary seems to study you:'For 500 gold I will join you, and fight to the death for you.'

556.value: You do not have enough gold.

557.value: The mercenary seems to study you:'For 1000 gold I will join you, and fight to the death for you.'

558.value: The mercenary seems to study you:'For 5000 gold I will join you, and fight to the death for you.'

559.value: Welcome to the Aldon's Stand Barracks and Militia, what can I do for you?

56.value: As Old Ms.Burgress slumps to the ground, you realize you have the proof you need.

560.value: Occasionally, there are mercenaries here who you can hire.

561.value: The Council needs to speak with you now, they are waiting for you upstairs.

562.value: Well <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>, we have a new problem. The Decessus Tome mentions a powerful artifact called the Orb of Kal-Dun.

563.value: The Tome mentions it can be used to summon powerful undead, far more powerful than the various zombies and skeletons you have encountered so far.

564.value: Find the Orb. It must be recovered before it falls into the wrong hands.

565.value: That is the problem. All we know is that it is across the isthmus in the land of Madancia in an ancient fortress.

566.value: An ancient fortress called Gailemire, thousands of years old, its location could not be found in any scroll or tome.

567.value: There are some small settlements in Madancia, maybe someone there will know. This is a dire task, you must not fail!

57.value: Hmm, this is dire news, indeed. Go talk to Father Keegan over at the church, he might know something.

570.value: The Orb must be found! Dark forces are already at work searching for it as well!

571.value: I will order the Western Gates opened for you, good luck on your journey!

572.value: Prefect Urik seems a bit uncomfortable:&'Be careful <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>, things aren't always as they seem.'

573.value: The sign reads:&The Swift Arrow.&Fling Death from afar!

574.value: If your henchmen have both a ranged and melee weapon equipped, they will switch automatically to the most appropriate weapon.

575.value: The sign reads:&Aldon's Stand Armory. Unauthorized Entry Forbidden!

576.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the village of Five Dials.

577.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to Kreegan's Trading Stand and Inn.

578.value: Welcome to trading post and inn adventurer, what can I do for you?

579.value: What do you want to talk about?

58.value: Lets go into your house and look around.

580.value: Hmm, sorry. I have never heard of that.

581.value: Gailemire? That has a familiar ring to it. Hmm...ask Ol' Nesmond upstairs about it.

582.value: The closest training is Aldon's Stand. Other than that it is Silver Point, far away on the east coast.

583.value: Hello, my name is Nesmond, what can I help you with?

584.value: What do you want to talk about?

585.value: People huh? Which people interest you?

586.value: Not much is known about Aldon's life before the Great war. It was never known where he was born, or even when he was born.

587.value: This mystery surrounding the early portion of his life has fed the belief that he was a supernatural being come to save everyone, though I don't believe that.

588.value: It is a well known fact that Princess Loriana kept journals, but strangely, the journal from the Great War period has never been found.

589.value: Well, my theory is that Aldon told Loriana something about his past as he lay dying in her arms. Maybe that he was a peasant, or even a bandit in his past!

59.value: Ah, a chest your Uncle left behind. To open a chest just tap it. Once the contents are on the ground you will have to pick them up.

590.value: So, in order to protect him, she hid that particular journal after she recorded it. So wonderfully noble, protecting the man she and the whole city loved.

591.value: Well, after King Orin's assassination, and faced with Ragna's invasion, Aldon's life and his death united Everon.

592.value: I do not know much about Ragna, except that she is possibly the most powerful sorceress in the known world.

593.value: Well, let's see, she looks young, but she is actually very old. I assume she uses some nefarious evil magic to maintain her beauty.

594.value: Aldon became the focus of all her hatred because he unifed Everon and thwarted her invasion. Her assassin Suttar killed him.

595.value: Ragna enchanted a poisonous arrow and had her assassin Suttar strike Aldon down with it.

596.value: There is not much more to tell. Many believe her to have died after her defeat in the Great War, but there is no proof of that.

597.value: Places huh? Which places interest you?

598.value: Aldon's Stand, also known as Aldon's Crossing was originally the city of Kaldania. King Orin ruled Everon and much of Madancia from there.

599.value: After the Great War, Kaldania was rebuilt and named Aldon's Stand in memory of Aldon's heroic stand againts evil.
599.choice_a: Why is it called Aldon's Crossing?

6.value: You empty the chest onto the floor.

60.value: Now we move on top of the loot you wish to pick up.

600.value: In time, travelling citizen's began to refer to it as Aldon's Crossing because the city guarded the crossing into Madancia.

601.value: Why would you want to know of that place? It is a very evil and dangerous place!

602.value: Well, I didn't live this long by prying into other people's business. I will give you this warning though, I have never known anyone to return from there alive.

603.value: Almost directly due north of us here.  It was overgrown by the forest hundreds of years ago, but it is still there.

604.value: Silver Point can be found many, many miles to the East.  There is a settlement there that has done reasonably well.

605.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to the village of Silver Point.

606.value: The sign reads:&SOUTH:&Zanuck Outpost.&EAST:&Village of Silver Point

607.value: The sign reads:&Welcome to Zanuck Outpost.

608.value: I am Grundahar the smith, what can I do for you?

609.value: The secret to crafting special items, is having a fine precious stones, or jewelry. Lets see if you have any...

61.value: Now tap the 'Pickup Icon' and tap on your Player to grab the loot! Then leave your room.

610.value: I'm sorry, you don't have anything I can work with, please come back later.

611.value: You have an emerald, with that and a magic dagger I could craft an Assassin's Dagger for you, plus a fee of 1000 gold.

612.value: You don't have a magic dagger, come back when you do.

613.value: You don't have enough gold for my fee, come back when you do.

614.value: You have a sapphire, with that and a magic short bow, I could craft a Ice Bow for you, plus a fee of 750 gold.

615.value: You don't have a magic short bow, come back when you do.

616.value: You have a ruby, with that and a magic short bow, I could craft a Fire Bow for you, plus a fee of 750 gold.

617.value: You have a perfect pearl! With that and magic plate gauntlets, I could craft Gauntlets of Power for you! Plus a fee of 3000 gold of course.

618.value: You don't have magic plate gloves, come back when you do.

619.value: You have a gold ring, with that and a potion of troll's blood I could craft for you a ring of regeneration. Plus a fee of 1250 gold of course.

62.value: Lets go back to the main room to examine the items you received.

620.value: You have a jeweled necklace! With that and a silver token, I could craft a Prayer Beads necklace! Plus a fee of 4000 gold of course.

621.value: You don't have a silver token, come back when you do.

622.value: You have a gold necklace! With that and a magic kite shield, I could craft a Shield Necklace! Plus a fee of 2000 gold of course.

623.value: You don't have a magic kite shield, come back when you do.

624.value: The golden statue is here to celebrate the Arena Champion.  The name plate is blank with the words '80 victories' beneath.

625.value: Statue of <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>!&&Greatest Arena Fighter of All Time!

626.value: Arena Rank is earned by defeating monsters in the Arena.  You are the current Arena Champion.

627.value: Congratulations Champion! We honor you with this statue and with this special gift, use it well!

629.value: No, NO! You tell your Dark Mistress that she will serve my Dark Master forever!

63.value: 'Inventory' and 'Status' work the same as 'Pickup'. Tap on them then tap on the person you wish to Equip or check Status on.

630.value: Even if you defeat me, you will never defeat my brother! We will protect the Master! DIE!

631.value: My Master knows you are here! He will give me the power to defeat you!

632.value: Even if it isn't, you still  have him to face! He will rend the flesh from your bones!

633.value: My Master wields the Orb of Kal-Dun! Now witness his power!

634.value: Welcome mortal, I congratulate you for getting this far, the Dark Mistress chose well, but this is where it ends!

635.value: She covets the Orb? For this she invades my palace, and slays my servants? Very well, I will give YOU a taste of the Orb, then She will be next!

636.value: The sign reads:&Zanuck Outpost&The Laughing Orc Inn.

637.value: The sign reads:&Zanuck Outpost&Fillian's Trading Post.

638.value: The sign reads:&Domicile of Lord Yorrick&Council Leader.

639.value: The sign reads:&Domicile of Prefect Urik&Council Member.

64.value: The 'Combat' button is used to switch between an equipped ranged and melee weapon.

640.value: The sign reads:&Domicile of Prefect Trillian&Council Member.

642.value: My name is Fillian, what do you need?

643.value: Use caution when travelling in this land. Many inexperienced adventurers meet with a horrible demise.

644.value: Welcome to the Laughing Orc Inn, what can I do for you?

645.value: To find Kreegan's Outpost, follow the road to the north, and look for an old road running west.

646.value: Astounding! You have recovered the Orb! Simply astounding! Now we can keep it safe from evil hands!

647.value: Where did you hear about the Dark Mistress?

648.value: The Dark Mistress usually refers to Tante Ragna the Sorceress, the very same one who slew Aldon.

649.value: If she has a hand in this, then that might explain what is going on at the Aldon's Stand Cemetery!

65.value: The 'Customize' feature allows you to set what the buttons do.  Activate it then tap on a button. Pick the potion from the list of all the abilities.

650.value: A runner just arrived from the Cemetery saying that graverobbers had infiltrated the Tomb of Aldon!

651.value: The remaining guard sealed the tomb.  Please, go quickly and stop them from defiling Aldon's grave, as they must surely be intending!

653.value: Please hurry! The citizens of Aldon's Stand would be devastated if Aldon's grave was defiled!

654.value: Aldon and Loriana's Tomb is currently closed to visitors.

655.value: I guard Aldon and Loriana's Tomb, what can I do for you?

656.value: I hope you kill those vile graverobbing scum, they are locked inside!

657.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Loriana&Princess of Everon&Love of Aldon.

658.value: The sign reads:&Tomb of Aldon&Defender of Everon&Love of Loriana.

659.value: The statue depicts a beautiful, graceful and solemn Loriana. Heartbroken, yet unbroken after losing both her Father and Aldon.

66.value: Now you have an idea on how to use the interface. Go to www.constantgames.com for more instructions.

660.value: The statue depicts a handsome, strong, and defiant Aldon.

661.value: We have come for the body of Aldon, and we will not be stopped by guards or even some council lap dog!

662.value: You can't leave this way, the guards are coming!

663.value: Well <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>, once again you return successful in you mission.  Your uncle would be proud of you I am sure!

664.value: I mean it all turned out so perfect! I have to admit, I had my doubts, but she was right!

665.value: The defeat of the Crescent Society at Aldon's Tomb was the coup de grace! The way to her revenge has been cleared, and by an unsuspecting child no less!

666.value: Oh don't be angry! If it makes you feel any better, you got further than your uncle did. He wouldn't co-operate.

667.value: Well those bandits I hired bungled the job, I had to clean up the mess, and after all, it is what I do best.

668.value: You haven't guessed yet? I'm Ragna's favorite, Suttar. Or at least I became her favorite after that harpy stole Aldon away.

669.value: King Orin's daughter you fool! Aldon fell in LOVE with her, oh please! He should have killed her like he did the King!

670.value: Aldon killed the King as ordered, and the city fell into chaos, but that wench began to rally them, speaking of honor and courage, blah blah, makes me sick!

671.value: Of course he did! He was an assassin. He was supposed to kill the girl too, but he fell in LOVE. How pathetic!

672.value: Do I? How then was Aldon able to formulate such a PERFECT defense? THINK YOU FOOL! He KNEW!

673.value: I really don't care what you believe. I had to strike my own brother down! MY OWN BROTHER! All over that interfering WOMAN!

674.value: I don't think so, you can't stop us now. Besides, your in enough trouble over killing the City Council.

675.value: The Prefect is just standing there, unresponsive.

676.value: You don't have a potion of troll's blood, come back when you do.

677.value: A runner arrived from Black Springs, Loranna the Mage Guildmaster is requesting aid for her kidnapped son, Timmy.

678.value: I have heard the thieves have a guild in the sewers, but I don't know where, and the sewers are huge. Someone else might know where they are.

679.value: There is something sneaky going on in that alley behind then inn.

680.value: This is the crumbling wall you pushed out of the way.

681.value: This is an entrance into an old hideout of some sort, maybe for smugglers. The gate is unlocked, and you push it open. All seems quiet...

682.value: This body, much like the others in this place lies uncovered and unburied. The sun has bleached the bones white.

683.value: The sign is very faint and hard to read:&'Sta. .ut of the wel. or el.e.'&That is all you can make out.

684.value: The well is very deep, and it is hard to see the bottom. There are some rusty rungs on the inside of the well leading down into the darkness.

685.value: The water in the well is up to the rim. There are some rusty rungs leading up the well tunnel into the sunlight.

686.value: There is a strange moss illuminating the area. It is difficult to see very far, but you hear faint noises in the distance.

687.value: This room appears to be the only room that was tunnelled out by hand.

688.value: This bookshelf seems out of place here. On closer inspection, you see a book that is about to fall off the shelf.

689.value: Welcome the Silver Point Barracks, what can I do for you?

69.value: What can the Unseen Hand do for you today?

690.value: This is a harsh and unforgiving land, one must take care when travelling.

691.value: We came out here to forge a life far away from the Council and Aldon's Stand.

692.value: Some of us to escape, others to start life anew, some - both.

693.value: Something troubles the man in the backroom, but he refuses any aid.

694.value: Things aren't TOO crowded now, but we will have to expand the village soon!

695.value: The sign reads:&The Crescent Moon.&General Store.

696.value: Just between you and me, I hate this place! I am soooo bored. Worst assignment I ever got.

697.value: Prefect Urik is still alive, barely!&'Oh...I am a fool. Please listen, I don't have much time left..'

698.value: This is Loriana's coffin, you examine it closely...

699.value: The coffin seems to be undisturbed.

7.value: The sign reads:&The Dragon's Tooth. Finest weapons available!

70.value: Welcome to the Black Spring Barracks!  What can I do for you today?

700.value: The coffin begins to rumble and shake.  The heavy lid of the coffin slides away revealing something shiny inside.

701.value: This is Aldon's coffin, you examine it closely...

702.value: The seal on the coffin has been broken, and you easily push the lid away. Aldon's body is gone.

703.value: You see, I'm going to kill these two, frame you for the crime, and leave. (He pulls a out a strange device and presses a button)

704.value: I suspected something was strange with ..erk..Yorrick. I was too afraid to confront him..'&He takes a deep breath.

705.value: Yorrick..Suttar, whoever he is..he must be stopped. He has teleported back to Yorrick's house...

706.value: The guards...the guards will try to kill you...erk. Take my key, it will unlock the backdoor leading down into the sewers..secret door...

707.value: Ta..Ta..Two secret doors. One out of castle into sewer, one out of sewer into Yorricks...erk..He..has Sewer Key..you need..erk.

708.value: He is trying to hold on:&'Cre..Crescent Society..Silver Point..go there..tell them..avoid guards, sewers lead to...to Madancia.....sooo sorry I was scar...e...d...

71.value: This is your Uncle's gravestone, the inscription reads: "For all your struggles against evil, may you rest peacefully. Love, the People of Black Spring."

712.value: I cannot BEGIN to tell you how ANNOYING you are being, I have to be somewhere!

713.value: How did you get past the guards? Bah! It doesn't matter. Even if you succeed in killing me, which I doubt, you will never get out of this city alive!
713.choice_a: YOU won't leave the city alive!

714.value: I hope you provide more challenge than your uncle.

715.value: As Suttar slumps to the ground mortally wounded, he says nothing. He merely stares at you unbelieving.

716.value: Psst, hey! It's you! Oh this is good luck! Go find Doron at the Last Stand Inn!

717.value: Hey, this is REALLY embarrasing, but Nade is in jail. I could really use your help busting him out.

718.value: Oh thank you! If we get out of this, its the straight and narrow for us! No more stealing!

719.value: I would imagine we do what you did to get me out. Find the Sheriff's spare key, I just don't know where she lives.

72.value: News of this evil necromancy must be brought before the Council at the city of Aldon's Stand, speak with the Sheriff.

722.value: The Jail is in the northern part of town, but I don't know where her house is.

723.value: Thanks for helping us out again. As I promised, we are done with this life, here is all our old stuff. See ya around.

724.value: Redara begins to say something when she sees your Crescent Amulet:&'Gaison's amulet. It's you. You are the one who killed him and the others.'

725.value: He went to Aldon's Tomb to take Aldon's body to safety. To prevent Ragna from getting it. You ambushed him and his friends.

726.value: She seems to calm down:&'You were unwittingly working for Ragna and her assassin, Suttar. I apologize, you could not have known the evil you were doing.'

727.value: Your uncle was one of us. He began to suspect something was going on with the council. He contacted us, but was murdered before he could find out more.
727.choice_a: My uncle was one of what?

728.value: The Crescent Society. We were founded 300 years ago by Princess Loriana herself.

729.value: As I was saying, when Aldon lay dying in Loriana's arms, he told her who he was, and what he did. Do you know?

73.value: Aldon's Stand is sometimes known as Aldon's Crossing, because it guards the crossing to realm of Madancia.

730.value: Before I tell you, you must swear to keep our secret forever by joining the Crescent Society.

731.value: I am truly sorry to hear that. There is no one else who can stop Ragna, we are all certainly doomed.

732.value: Thank you for joining us. You do your uncle proud. You must understand, no one will blame you for Gaison and the others.

733.value: Sadly, it is all true, and more. Aldon was Ragna's Chief Assassin, and her army's Field General. He killed King Orin, plunging the city into chaos.

734.value: Princess Loriana was his next target, but upon listening to her encourage and lift the morale of her people, something touched Aldon's spirit.

735.value: Maybe it was Loriana's strength and courage, maybe it was the will of the Redeemer, regardless, he fell in love with her. In doing so he betrayed Ragna, and his brother Suttar.

736.value: With his exceptional military skills, Aldon quickly attracted the attention of both Loriana, and the city's defenders. It wasn't long before Aldon was leading the city's defense.

737.value: Loriana fell in love with Aldon, believing him to be nothing more than a brilliant, courageous soldier defending her people. The people loved him as well.

738.value: Enraged by her defeat, Ragna ordered Suttar to kill Aldon. As he lay dying he confessed to Loriana, and asked her forgiveness. His last words were:

739.value: 'I hope one true deed can wash away a lifetime of evil, wash me clean so that I may enter paradise and see you again someday, good bye.'

74.value: Rumor:&They say Tante Ragna never died, that she still lives in her Dark Tower in Madancia!

740.value: Redara shows you a small bound journal:&'This is Loriana's missing journal. Entrusted to us to protect and watch over.'

741.value: We believe Ragna intends to ressurect Aldon, and use him to invade Everon as he was originally ordered to do.

742.value: Why? Vengeance, pure and simple. How? The Decessus Tome, the Orb of Kal-Dun, and Aldon's body. That's all she needs.

743.value: Not for long! You must sneak through the city sewers and goto the tomb. You must be sure his body is safe! Go now, hurry!

744.value: Hurry to Aldon's Tomb, and beware, most of the guards will attack you on sight!

745.value: Oh no, oh no. We are too late then. She will resurrect Aldon, and force him to lead her new armies against us!

746.value: You would do this, face this evil?

747.value: Spoken like your uncle. Ragna's tower lies far to the west, past the great mountains. You will not be able to pass the mighty gates she has raised there.

75.value: Rumor:&They say that one day Aldon will return!

751.value: Good luck <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>, our hopes go with you!

752.value: Hello, I am the Sheriff of Aldon's Stand, what can I do for you?

753.value: I have heard rumors of a new thieves guild causing trouble for the unseen hand.

754.value: Well, my sources say they are in the sewer. But they are much more secretive than the Unseen Hand.

755.value: My house, why would you want to know where my house is? Have you been talking to Doron or Nade?

756.value: You find a folded note under the bed:&'Don't forget! Empty house, hidden key.'

757.value: You find a folded note in the refuse pile:&'Note to self, forgot again. Not this empty house.'& Is all it says.

758.value: Deep in the pool of water, you find a key.

759.value: The sign reads:&Quarters of Korut the Beastmaster

76.value: The city of Kaldania was renamed Aldon's Stand, to honor him after his sacrifice in the Great War.

760.value: You have gotten past my children, and probably hurt or killed some of them..for this you shall pay with your blood!

761.value: You finally stand before Ragna, she address you:&'<INSERT_THE_PLAYER>, you have been aggravatingly persistent.'

762.value: No matter where your uncle is now, I'm sure he is proud. Oh wait, I just remembered!

763.value: Your uncle is here! Why don't you ask him yourself if he is proud?

764.value: Thank you for releasing me <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>! You have done very well, and I am proud of you.

765.value: Unfortunately, it is not over yet. You must follow Ragna through the portal and finish it.

766.value: Your precious uncle now serves ME in death, as he should have in life. You will serve me in death as well.

767.value: Yes. Yes you will. I have something important to attend to. I will leave you two to get reacquainted.

768.value: I know you will....(he fades away).

769.value: You feel nauseated as the world shifts around you.

77.value: Rumor:&They say that orcs have moved into the abandoned fortress, Darkmoor, far to the south!

770.value: Pathetic puny meddler! My anger for you knows no bounds! But in the end you will fail!

771.value: That won't be for much longer, you won't live long enough to witness Aldon's original destiny!

772.value: No, you will face the wrath of your own 'hero'.

773.value: The locket you found in Loriana's Tomb begins to glow and radiate heat. Aldon stops, as if listening to something.

774.value: Aldon opens his mouth to speak, his voice ancient and hollow:&'Lo..Lori...Lori-a-na...'

775.value: He reaches out to you, and suddenly the locket leaps from your hand to his.

776.value: As Aldon closes his hand around the locket, you hear him moan in sorrow:&'Lori..Lori..'

777.value: Aldon turns to face Ragna:&'No more Ragna, no more...I will not betray Lori's memory, all she sacrificed.'

778.value: He turns to face you:&'Thank you...thank you for this.'&Aldon then collapses and is gone.

779.value: As Aldon collapses and dies for a second time, you hear a scream from Ragna:&'Noooooooo!'

78.value: You should talk to Henry upstairs, something in the cemetery scared him good!

780.value: Nooooo! What have you done?! YOU FOOL! You have spoiled everything!

781.value: Thank you <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>! You have released me from Ragna, and released the world from her evil.

782.value: Your work is now done; you may exit the tower through the portal.

783.value: Redara of the Crescent Society has already explained what happened. You will be safe and welcome in Aldon's Stand.

784.value: Farewell <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>. I can no longer hold my spirit to this dimension.

785.value: Congratulations <INSERT_THE_PLAYER> for defeating Tante Ragna! You are a hero!

786.value: Now that you have defeated Tante Ragna, are you gonna delete us?

788.value: Hee hee ho ho! Tee hee! I know where YOU are going!

789.value: Welcome to our makeshift mining town.  Well not much of a town yet but we are working on it.

79.value: Something funny is going on behind the Green Monkey Inn.  I wonder what Viggo has going on over there..

790.value: You stand before the mighty gates that guard the entrance to Ragna's stronghold. You can't even budge them.

791.value: Oh thank you! You might want to try the village of Five Dials first, that is where he was last headed.

794.value: This is a quiet shipping and fishing village, though we do occasionally have bandit troubles.

795.value: Yes, I know of your uncle's death. The bandits who killed your uncle still raid the local area.

796.value: They usually inhabit the forest just outside of the village, but they aren't always there.

797.value: Tarn? Yes I know of him. He comes here to pick up his iron shipment every few weeks or so.

798.value: Hmm, check with the quartermaster on the dock. Tarn gets his shipment from him.

799.value: I'm sorry, you don't. Return if you find one.

8.value: The sign reads:&The Dragon's Scale. Finest armors available!

80.value: You should talk the old man who lives in the southwest part of town, down by the river. He was friends with your Uncle.

800.value: Have you ever seen one of these?&(He shows you a silver token)&They are very old and very rare. I will give you something very valuable for any you find.

801.value: Ah, so you do. I offer you either a baby dragonling who fights with his fierce bite, or a baby fire-breathing dragon.

802.value: Treat this creature with great care. It is very young, but loyal. In time it will grow to be very powerful.

803.value: The sign reads:&Five Dials' Quartermaster Office and Warehouse.

804.value: Greetings, I am the Quartermaster. What can I do for you?

805.value: I'm sorry. I'm a busy man with no time for chit-chat.

806.value: I haven't seen him since he came in for his last iron shipment.

807.value: Well, yes now that you mention it. He came back several hours later and sold the shipment back to me for half its value.

808.value: He mentioned something about funds for an emergency trip, or something like that.

81.value: Hey, my brother is in the jail for reasons to small to mention.  I need to bust him out and get him out of town.

810.value: As you approach the clearing, you hear several men arguing over something...

811.value: '..told you takin that job was a mistake! That old man keeled ol' Bog!'

812.value: '..shut yer mouf Gan. That ol' man was tough! He was beaten us all up.'

813.value: '..I thinks that fella was just usin us to distract that ol'man. After all, he was the one stuck'em in tha back!'

814.value: '..both of you shut your mouths and grab your weapons, we have a visitor.'

815.value: On the body of the bandit leader you find what appears to be a contract for your uncle's murder.

816.value: An emergency trip? Where could he have gone? Oh I am so worried. I hope he is safe. Please find him.

818.value: Please leave me be. I wish to be alone.

819.value: Please leave me be. I wish to be alone.

82.value: Well, the sheriff is watching me too carefully for me to help directly.  You could break into the sheriff's house and find his spare jail key though..

820.value: So you've come to kill me. Just please promise you will spare my wife.

821.value: I can't go home. Those bandits said they would kill my wife if I ever returned to Aldon's Stand.

822.value: On my way back to Aldon's Stand from Five Dials, I stumbled upon some bandits standing over the body of the former Prefect of Black Springs.

823.value: One bandit was dead, and the rest were wounded. They were arguing about someone else who had apparently struck the Prefect down from behind.

824.value: The bandits discovered and recognized me. They threatened to kill my wife if I ever showed my face in Aldon's Stand again.

825.value: As long as those bandits live, I can't return and risk my wife's life.

826.value: You explain to Tarn that the bandits are dead, and he can return home.

827.value: Oh thank you! Next time you are in Aldon's Stand, come by please!

828.value: Tarn shakes your hand:&'Good to see you <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>!'

829.value: Congratulations <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>! You have now 'defeated' Aldon's Crossing!

83.value: You need the right skills to break in.  Behind this inn is the entrance to the thieves guild.  Somehow join them, then go get the key from the sheriff's house!

830.value: You may continue your current game or you may download other modules at www.aldonscrossing.com. ModMaker is also available to make your own modules!

831.value: Thank you from the Constant Games Inc. Crew:&   Michael Judge,&   Anthony Davis,&   David Price,&   and special thanks to&   Peter Chung!

832.value: North of the mountains is a dwarven mining camp, Kackle is a Society member, he will help you!

834.value: Thank you, we do try! Stop by again sometime!

835.value: Redara told me everything. Follow the rails till ye can go south. Be careful, and good luck!

836.value: The Curator seems lost in his thoughts...

837.value: I see you managed to recover the Orb of Kal-Dun from Ragna! Wonderful! I'll just take that...

838.value: I see you managed to recover the Decessus Tome from Ragna! Wonderful! I'll just take that...

839.value: The sign reads:& This display is currently empty.

84.value: Good you are a thief already. Go now and get the key from the sheriffs house.

840.value: The sign reads:& The Orb of Kal-Dun.&Recovered by <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>.

841.value: The sign reads:& The Decessus Tome.&Recovered by <INSERT_THE_PLAYER>.

842.value: The sign reads:&King Orin Memorial&Though his life was taken from Everon, his guidance and wisdom live on in her people.

843.value: This door is jammed and will not open.

85.value: The sheriffs house is in the north east part of town. Once you find the key go visit my brother and hand it to him.  Thats it!

86.value: Rescue my brother, then come back and talk to me.

87.value: You remember that Nade said you needed thief skills.

88.value: You find the key hidden in the fireplace.

89.value: Pssst...you're from my brother, ya got the key?

9.value: The sign reads:&NORTH:&The Green Monkey Inn.&WEST:&Renny's General Store.

90.value: He whispers: Thanks, I will wait til its clear, then sneak out of here!

91.value: As you enter the cemetery, you see a figure standing there, moaning and shuffling around...Ms.Burgress?

92.value: Your Uncle and I were good friends. We had many adventures together. Redeemer take his soul..

93.value: As you know, they say thieves killed him while returning from Aldon.  I don't believe it!  Your uncle was a great warrior, and always careful!

94.value: I don't know child.  Maybe if you impress the locals, they will make you the new Prefect of Black Spring.

95.value: Ask around, people always need help with their problems.

96.value: Once you become the Prefect, go to Aldon's Stand, and investigate your Uncle's death!

97.value: One more thing, I have a stray dog and cat with me. I cannot care for them both anymore. Would you please take one? It will be a loyal companion.

98.value: We are going to need a new town Prefect soon.

99.value: The sheriff needs to talk to you.
